Job description

Educator - Float

Goodstart is Australia’s largest early learning provider. As a not–for–profit social enterprise, we exist purely to improve the lives of Australia’s children and their families. Our people are our foundation, together we are working to ensure children have the learning, development and wellbeing outcomes they need for school and life.

We’re looking for an inspiring and enthusiastic Eductor who is passionate, nurturing and are able to provide fun and educational programs to children in our care.

As a passionate childcare professional you will be committed to providing the highest quality of care and will be rewarded with the opportunity to build your career within a supportive and rewarding environment. You must also be a strong communicator, both written and verbal.

Our centre
  • Welcoming and fun environment
  • A 57 place centre with bright spacious rooms
  • Centre is Meeting National Quality Standards
  • 99% capacity

Your role
  • Diploma level early childhood qualification (ACECQA approved)
  • Hold a current First Aid qualification
  • 6 month Fixed Term Contract
  • 37.5 hours a week on a rotating roster (Flexibilities with hours is a must have)


Responsibilities
  • Actively contribute to the education program in the Nursery and the centre team
  • Need to assist with documentation of children’s learning
  • Engage and supervise the children at all times
  • Maintain a safe environment for children, families and team members
  • Build and maintain strong, positive relationships with children and families
  • Comply with National Quality Standards and Goodstart policies and procedures
  • Support a culture of reflective practice and ongoing continuous improvement


The Benefits
  • Competitive above award wages
  • Supportive and friendly team
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • Comprehensive induction and training programme
  • Discounted childcare fees
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Career pathways
  • Uniform allowance

If you have a passion for working with children, then this is the role for you!

Goodstart is committed to child safety, with a zero tolerance of child abuse, and we look to reflect this commitment in our employees. Should you strive to uphold and reflect these values then we would love to hear from you!

To apply for the role please ‘Apply Now’ or to review the role PD please

Posting Notes: ENDEAVOUR HILLS, MELBOURNE || VIC || Australia (AU) || VIC North - Region 31 || SF:LI || Certificate III - Children's Services or equiv || Part-Time

Health Architect

Company Name Jacobs Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

Jacobs is a global provider of technical, professional and scientific services including engineering, architecture, construction, operations and project management. Our portfolio spans industrial, commercial, and government clients across multiple markets and geographies.

Our approach to design unifies architecture and engineering. We design by working directly through our multi-disciplinary approach, our clients and their stakeholders to understand user demands, technology and objectives.

When we design a transit centre, we bring an understanding of the entire transport network. When we design a research facility, we seek to understand the science. When we design a hospital, we develop facilities that respond to its specific model of care. We investigate technologies and operational trends, celebrating in our responses the union of architecture and engineering.

About The Opportunity

Drawing on our dedicated resources with successful keystone Health and Research projects across Australia, we help our clients shape their vision, shaping the future through what we do best in creating uniquely responsive and collaborative building designs. With our integrated approach to architecture and engineering, Jacobs has an enviable track record in the outstanding delivery of complex Health and Research facilities.

Jacobs is committed to supporting our clients and the increasing demand on hospitals and health services and is looking to further build on our recent award winning projects in NSW, QLD, ACT and Victoria.

Reporting to the Director for Architecture and working closely with our Health Sector Lead, you will lead the design, documentation and coordination of each project as part of our integrated design team. Your primary area of focus is in the delivery of projects to achieve design excellence and exceed client expectations.

About You

As a valued member of our architectural team you will be naturally creative and require the following skills, qualifications and experience to deliver exceptional value to our clients
  • Recognised Architectural Degree
  • Have relevant experience with Health projects in Victoria and/or ACT
  • Proficiency in Revit and Adobe Suite of programs
  • Understanding of BCA/NCC and Australian Standards
  • Working knowledge of Australasian Health Facility Guidelines
  • Technical construction knowledge
  • Outstanding and effective written and visual communication and presentation skills
  • Enthusiastic with proven ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team
  • Excellent time management with the ability to lead and work in a team

Why Jacobs

At Jacobs we value people. Having the right balance of diversity, career and lifestyle enables us to consistently deliver and exceed clients’ expectations.

Working alongside industry leaders, you will have the opportunity to develop your career working on key projects in an environment which encourages collaboration, knowledge sharing and innovation. To support your professional growth, Jacobs flexible working arrangements, extended leave options and a host of social, health and well-being events and initiatives will underpin our commitment to you. Rethinking how you work, our culture at Jacobs means it’s all about what you do, not where you are, which counts!

It’s a great time to join Jacobs. Achieve more with a global brand. Apply online by clicking on the link below. Please attach both a Resume as well as a Cover Letter.

Please note If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.

Job Qualifications

Primary Location

Australia-Australia Countrywide-Melbourne

BlackRock helps investors build better financial futures. As a fiduciary to our clients, we provide the investment and technology solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. As of June 30, 2018, the firm managed approximately $6.3 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit www.blackrock.com | Twitter: @blackrock | Blog: www.blackrockblog.com | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock.

Job Description:



Role Aim/Purpose:

  • To provide outstanding service to BlackRock Australia’s clients through accurate and timely administrative functions.



Major Responsibilities:

  • To provide outstanding administrative service to BlackRock Australia’s clients through accurate and timely processing of applications, redemptions, switches and transfers on the client order and unit registry systems
  • Record, maintain and store unit holder and adviser information
  • Assist in projects undertaken by the department from time to time and assist in any process of change in the area
  • To develop effective working relationships with colleagues from both inside and outside of the working unit
  • To enhance the unit’s business performance through effective communication and innovative thought
  • To learn and apply new skills and to facilitate change
  • To maintain and contribute to a compliant working environment
  • Be aware of administrative compliance issues and cut off times
  • Form an active part of the department offering ideas/suggestions to improve service/processes
  • Understand the Company structure and the inter-relationships between departments
  • Ensure a thorough knowledge of BlackRock’s products and the regulatory requirements as they affect Transfer Agency Services

  • Professional telephone manner
  • Accurate and efficient data entry skills

  • Organisational and time management skills
  • Product, business, industry knowledge
  • Relationship and team building skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills

Network Architect

Company Name Infosys Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Network Infrastrcture Architect plays a lead role in the delivery of projects and programmes driving the IT strategic change. A key contributor to the design and implementation of the solution ensuring that IT systems meet the required high standards in the areas of non-functional requirements particularly availability, capacity, performance, security and BCP. This role will be responsible for ensuring all Corporate-related solutions delivered are engineered in accordance with the infrastructure standards/patterns and align to the overall enterprise roadmap of the end customer.

The role is expected to carry out following function/activities as part of this job. This is exhaustive list but not limited to :

  • Work closely with business management to determine business process and productivity needs and an appropriate technology strategy to support business goals.
  • Triaging business problems and requests, taking decisions on whether to route these into either elaboration or delivery projects/programmes
  • Analyze technical needs, requirements, and state of the network’s infrastructure design, integration, and operations.
  • Decomposing business problems and mapping them to strategic technology architectures
  • Producing or providing input into Line of Business roadmaps
  • Producing strategic Technology Target State elaboration roadmaps
  • \xa0Identifying strategic technology opportunities and canvasing business support
  • Technical leadership of customer projects and oversee solution implementation
  • Product selection and capability testing for specific technology and versions
  • Proactively review customer solutions and propose improvements and strategic direction, anticipating client goals
  • Develop design principles, models, plans, internal standards, budgets, and processes based on industry best practices.
  • Lead teams of other network designers and engineers in developing detailed designs and quality-control mechanisms during implementation.
  • Establish governing principles for network design and deployment.
  • Participate in selection of networking technologies and products for implementation
  • Continually update understanding of business and technology status and objectives and respond to strategic design requests as the business evolves
  • Building strong partnership relationships with customers through presales and thought leadership activities
  • Managing vendors and suppliers
  • Promoting common delivery standards and processes
  • Developing white papers and presentations at industry related conferences
  • Experience of using automation tools and technologies for build and deployment
  • Performance planning, measurement and impact assessment
  • Creating , Updaing Highlevel and Low Level Design documents
  • Provide help to operations team in complex troubleshooting requirements
  • Manage Client relationships and perform ServiceDelivery activities..

Technical Expertise Area

  • Understanding of OSI Model, IP Protocol suites and Quality of Service.
  • Understanding of IPv4 & IPv6 IP address planning and implementations.
  • Product experience in Cisco,Juniper,F5,Riverbed,Cisco Nexus.
  • Network – WAN/LAN/WLAN/MAN/MPLS/VPN and data communications technologies.
  • Expertise in Routing and switching protocols – BGP, EIGRP, OSPF,HSRP,VRRP,LDP,RSVP, STP, RSTP, MSTP,Multicast,Policy based routing
  • TCP/IP packet analysis
  • Experience in complex MPLS/BGP WAN design and implementation
  • Data Center Virtualization-Architecture and Design Capabilities,Product Expertise in CISCO NEXUS 7000, 1000V, OTV,Consolidated I/O, \xa0Fibre Channel
  • Understanding on Managing Switches/Routers/Load blanacers/WAN Optimizers.
  • Advanced Knowledge of Routing, Switching,WAN Optimization and Load balalncing
  • Understanding of advanced network technologies and solutions including IPv6, MPLs, BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, HSRP, multicast, policy-based routing, ether-channel, QoS, traffic-shaping, Load balancing, VPN tunnels, WAN Optimization.
  • Clear understanding of 802.11a/b/g/n Wi-Fi standards and related components
  • Excellent Knowledge on Wireless Controller and Access Points implementation and troubleshooting including setup/configure wireless network (controller / Access points)
  • Design, plan, establish, and optimize wireless networks.
  • Develop wireless network infrastructures and make recommendations on systems enhancements for optimization.
  • Knowledge of Cisco Nexus 5k,7k and 9k and Riverbed steelhead CX,DX and EX series.
  • Experties in BIGIP F5 (LTM and GTM)
  • Load Balancing, including priority group activation and connection limits. Persistence concepts
  • BIG-IP GTM: Global Traffic Manager - Installation and Licensing, Accelerated and Intellegent DNS Resolutions, LDNS Probes and Metrics, DNSSEC, iRules, Synchronization, DNS Integration, iHealth
  • BIG-IP LTM: Local Traffic Manager - licensing, provisioning, network configuration, local traffic configuration, Dynamic load balancing methods, Traffic processing through virtual servers/ SNATs, Configuring high availability, Traffic behavior modifications with profiles
  • Advanced BIG-IP LTM configurations - VLAN tagging and trunking, SNMP features and packet filters
  • Configure Cisco Nexus 7k 5k series
  • Configure ASA firewalls, Cisco Next-Gen firewalls experience, MPLS, F5 expertise
  • Knowledge of JUNOS/Juniper Platform is highly preferred.
  • Good understanding of Juniper Q-Fabric Operation & Design.
  • Advanced knowledge of Juniper VPN gateway’s Operation & Design
  • Juniper/Cisco Integration
  • Understanding of various tools like , SOlarwinds , ServiceNow etc .
  • Netwrok Services Delivery

\xa0

Experience/Skill requirements

\xa0

All Job function will require to be demonstrated in following specialised area of IT \xa0 Infrastructure

\xa0

Preferred

This section describes the applicants required experience, skills set and knowledge about various products in the functional expertise area

\xa0

  • A thorough understanding of architectural design principles.
  • Years of experience: 8 years plus of working experience in IT infrastrcture Design and Architecture functions
  • Knowledge of managing data centre in terms of systems monitoring, capacity planning and performance tuning.
  • Ability to operate in a fast-paced, evolving environment and appropriately prioritize tasks, and keep abreast of the latest technology.
  • Capability to work with people in different time zones
  • Technical knowledge and experience in management of large enterprise customers network
  • An individual contributor capable of self-directed work showing strong leadership and client relationship skills and who is focused on driving the complete network project.
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills, Customers handling and stakeholer management skills.
  • Strong experience in implementing and supporting networks for mid-to-large corporate customers.
  • Proven ability to work collaboratively with designers, architects, sales staff, field technicians and external customers.
  • Knowledge of current technological trends and developments in the areas of advance networking
  • Exposure on Cisco/Juniper/Riverbed/F5 technologies and Data Center Networks.
  • Ability to influence, persuade and mobilize internal/external resources to fulfill customer requirements.
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong & effective customer relationships.
  • Well organized and able to do multi-tasking, problem solving, trouble shooting techniques and strategic thinking.
  • Analytical skills to interpret IT user requests and understand end user requirements.
  • Solid knowledge of the IT Service Management framework, practices, and process experience in Information Technology.
  • Service Delivery tasks , like , reporting , customer relationship , SLA management etc.

\xa0

Education Qualification

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering. Number of years of experience may vary based on Bachelors or Master’s Degree. Any additional education will be added advantage.


Certifications

• CCIE/CCDE/CCAr,JNCDS-DC,JNCDS-WAN, F5-CA,F5-CTS,F5-CSE,Riverbed

Company Name AHS Hospitality - a Chandler Macleod Group Business Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 57 views

Job description

  • A position which challenges your thinking and encourages your creativity
  • Be an integral part of our marketing team
  • Drive brand awareness across two business units


Are you looking for your next opportunity, which challenges your thinking and encourages your creativity where no two days or projects are the same?


This is your chance to join the Chandler Macleod group, working across two of it’s business units -\xa0AHS Hospitality and Vivir Healthcare as our Marketing Specialist, reporting directly to both Executive General Managers.


Supporting the AHS & Vivir teams in Digital and Design you’ll be at the heart of building the visual brand for the two businesses and you’ll be able to turn your hand to a multitude of tasks from producing collateral in design templates to coordinating our online brand hub for our full brand family, from drafting content to coordinating web projects and providing high quality and timely graphic design solutions.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Designing and producing marketing materials (including copywriting)
  • Graphic design support for tenders and client presentations
  • Graphic design support for internal communications
  • Graphic design support for website, eDM, digital advertising and social media activities as required
  • Producing finished art from layout designs
  • Following style sheets and brand guidelines to provide sales collateral
  • Writing content, liaising with external agencies, creating digital assets, and conducting social media activities to ensure our primary social media pages are constantly active
  • Project coordination of large design/production jobs such as ebooks and white papers, including day to day task management of the team’s design activities


About you:

  • Strong understanding of design and general marketing principles and their role in a commercial enterprise
  • Strong knowledge of Adobe creative suite CC, InDesign, Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
  • Creative skills in the conceptualization and execution of high quality, professional design for a broad range of marketing, sales and operational executions
  • Digital savvy with a genuine interest in latest trends within commercial design
  • Strong level of attention to detail for proof reading and design review
  • Ability to maintain up to date, practical and accurate library of design materials
  • Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills – demonstrated customer service skills
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and work under pressure


Apply today!
For a confidential discussion, please don't hesitate to contact Elisa Midolo HR Specialist at elisa@vivir.com.au or on (03) 8629 2607


If your application progresses to interview, we’d love to see a small portfolio of your best work.

Business Development Manager

Company Name WGSN Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 177 views

Job description

Business Development Manager
WGSN – Australia and New Zealand\xa0


WGSN Group is the World’s leading fashion trend forecaster with global offices and over 6,000 customers around the world, working with every Retailer on the Fortune 500 and key fashion brands across Europe, Asia, Latin America, and North America. WGSN group provides solutions to the fashion, retail, CPG, and interiors markets across Product development, marketing, customer segmentation, and more.


Job Description
The Senior Business Development Manager will generate new revenue and grow existing WGSN accounts through a structured consultative sales approach either face to face or via the telephone. These sales will be liaising directly with senior decision makers across the Fashion value chain.\xa0


Key Accountabilities

  • Developing new business opportunities
  • Selling or Upselling the entire WGSN suite of solutions to either new or existing clients
  • Key responsibilities to include following up inbound leads, own lead generation through cold calling and working closely with the marketing team on marketing campaigns to key prospects.
  • Arranging & attending meetings with prospects, making C-Level presentations including demonstrations of the site; drafting proposals and contract documents and consistent networking within the industry.
  • For existing clients upsell or cross sell opportunities the job includes training of users regarding best usage of the services, internal networking in order to identify new opportunities and potential users, follow usage and make services recommendations to users at all levels within the company


Desired Skills & Experience
  • Proven track record of consultative solution selling
  • Previous experience within the information industry, fashion, outsourcing, software sales or other service offerings would be a distinct advantage
  • A degree in any discipline is preferable
\xa0
Company Description
WGSN, the world-leading b2b fashion forecasting service, is currently looking for a Senior Business Development Manager to be based in their Melbourne office.
WGSN is the World’s Global Style Network, digital subscription products include WGSN Trend, WGSN Insight, WGSN INstock, and WGSN Mindset bespoke consultancy services.
\xa0
WGSN has trend and information hubs in New York, Hong Kong, S\xe3o Paulo and London and has 16 offices around the world. We employ approximately 500 people, and more than 50% of our talent are content experts. WGSN seeks talent globally to work within a business that offers a unique blend of creativity and intelligence, of intuition and analysis to empower our customers to create tomorrow.

Meet our people and find out what makes Ascential so special
